meaningMnemonic: The kanji means <kanji>delicate</kanji>, and so does this word. Something that's <vocabulary>delicate</vocabulary> is probably also <vocabulary>faint</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>indistinct</vocabulary>. So use 微か to describe things like faint sounds, delicate breezes, and indistinct memories.
readingMnemonic: You should speak in a <vocabulary>delicate</vocabulary> and <vocabulary>faint</vocabulary> voice when you <reading>cuss</reading> (かす). So delicate that the cuss words are <vocabulary>indistinct</vocabulary> to other people, even. It's the only acceptable way to cuss.
